DOC.brief_summary: This comparative pharmacokinetic , pharmacodynamic safety study healthy volunteer three form pegylated granulocyte colony stimulate factor .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparative , Crossover , Pharmacokinetic , Pharmacodynamic Safety Study Three Forms PEG-G-CSF Normal Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: 1 . Healthy male female subject age 18 55 year 2 . A standardized body mass index 3 . General good health determine Investigator 4 . Normal organ function per Investigator 's judgement 5 . Must nonsmoker , exsmokers smoke within previous 6 month screen visit 6 . Female subject must : Not lactate ; pregnant Agree use acceptable contraceptive method nonchildbearing potential 7 . Male subject must refrain donate sperm father child study 3 month last study drug 1 . Known hypersensitivity Escherichia coli derived protein , pegfilgrastim , filgrastim related component 2 . Presence antibody polyethylene glycol screen 3 . Positive result cotinine ( > 500 ng/mL ) drug abuse screen admission 4 . Prior history current alcohol abuse excessive intake alcohol judge Investigator 5 . Donation blood ( â‰¥500 mL ) plasma within previous 3 month 6 . History unexplained syncopal episode ; 7 . Any disorder , Investigator 's opinion , may interfere study compliance 8 . History cancer 9 . History pulmonary infiltrate pneumonia within previous 6 month screen visit 10 . Hereditary fructose and/or sorbitol intolerance 11 . Absolute neutrophil count 1500/mm3 12000/mm3 screen 12 . Positive test hepatitis B surface antigen , hepatitis C antibody , human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) 1 2 13 . Any abnormality 12lead ECG Investigator 's opinion clinically significant and/or suggestive underlying cardiac abnormality 14 . A clinical diagnosis hypertension , significant hypercholesterolemia judge Investigator , thyroid abnormality 15 . Family history acute myeloid leukemia subject splenomegaly baseline , sickle cell disease 16 . Any prescribed counter medication include analgesic , herbal remedy , vitamin therapy must use 7 day prior first administration study drug
